In the Beginning urlLink The Old Convolution meets urlLink The New Convolution Welcome to the next edition of The Convolution

Dee Dee Ramone First Joey and now just a few months after the Hall of Fame Induction ceremony, Dee Dee Ramone passes away at the age of only 50. I am not a Ramones fan but I know what they meant to the history of music and this is just another surprising loss in the world of punk.

Do I think John Ashcroft overstated the dirty bomb conspiracy? Yes, yes he did. That's the first thing that came to my mind when they released the information about the big arrest at Chicago O'Hare. It was obvious he wants to take some heat off the FBI in a time when they are getting grilled. I don't doubt this guy Jose Padilla is a bad dude and was up to something, but Ashcroft is making the story bigger than it really is. And that's just my two cents.

I just have to say thank you. Thank you to Korn for putting out an incredible album. Every song is pounding but at the same time melodic. Loud but soft in spots. Jonathon Davis on this album totally uses every single inch of his voice capabilities. From that raucous loud to that high pitch soft voice. I didn't get Issues which people say was pretty bad. But I have to say people will embrace this album. I have to say, this is the first album in a long time that I was hoping for a lot and got more than that. If I have to pick one song that rises above the others, it's Hollow Life(track 4). But every song just kicks ass. I also got Tragically Hip's In Violet Light. I have to say that I was a bit disappointed with this album. But I already know that this album will grow on me like every Hip album does. Just need to have more listens to it. Did I mention How much I loved Korn's album? Damn good album. I highly recommend it. Other news. Ireland cruises into the round of 16 in the world cup. The whole country is going mad. Waiting for USA to play their final game in the first round to see if they get into the next round. They play Poland. Hopefully USA will beat a team of Wiesaks. In the next few weeks, I hope to have some renovation done on my geocities site. Just haven't been up to making the changes. I will eventually though. Until next time, later

My work week is over already. Busy weather means my work week flies by. Still waiting to hear if I get off on the 13th of July. If I don't, then no attendance at a wedding for me. If I do get the day off then I'll be the dude at the bar at Fisher's Tudor House. I have absolutely nothing else to add right now. Don't feel like writing. later

Guys, you must check out this urlLink satellite photo of the snow cover over the Northeast... IT IS VERY COOL!! If you want a more detailed, HIGH resolution photo, just check out the link above the photo that says 1 km. This 1 km resolution photo is extremely large so download time will be quite long on dial up connection. A thing to note on this picture, you can see the darkened areas located where D.C., Philadelphia, New York, and Boston reside. You can also see the partially frozen Lake Erie and Lake Ontario. You can easily see the Finger Lakes of New York and the rippled Appalachian Mtns of Pennsylvania and where the three rivers come together to meet Pittsburgh.

What is one of the best shows on TV right now that nobody in the United States has seen? The Answer: urlLink The Trailer Park Boys It's a Canadian television show on a network called Showcase which is very similar to HBO. Now what do I suggest in order to watch the episodes? (By the way, Season 3 starts on April 3rd). Kazaa or other shared file networks will get the job done. Steve B., I know you are big into downloading certain television episodes so I highly recommend you look into this show! Give it a shot with Season 1 Episode 1 and you'll get hooked. The characters in this show are incredible.....Ricky, Julian, Bubbles, Mr. Lahey, Randy, etc. The show is basically about a bunch of degenerates(mainly Ricky and Julian) who live in a trailer park and try to put their convict lives behind them and lead a straight and narrow life but continually get pulled back into the criminal way of life. That description may make this show sound like a drama but it certainly isn't!! It's one of the funniest shows out there today that nobody knows about. If you ever get a chance to watch an episode, you must check it out! Maybe I'll bring up a few cd's-worth of episodes when I come up to PA. I'm out....

Ok Ok, I know most of you had to put up with snow and sleet and cold for more than three months now but just last night(Wed night into Thurs morn.), my house in Marietta picked up more than 3 inches of rain in less than 12 hours! T-storm after t-storm passed over northern suburbs of ATL. The rivers and creeks of north Georgia were overrunning their banks and street flooding and mudslides were reported across the area. Now it is safe to say that I will not be playing soccer anytime soon. Our first two game were rained out and now the fields will be a swampy mess....a quagmire if you will. The fields not only won't recover by this weekend but they will likely be a mess for weeks to come. Oh well. Patrick T., this may be a good idea from Apple, but can't you already download any generic mp3 onto your iPod as it is??? Why is this necessary? This is taken from eonline.com : "Apple Computers and the major record labels joining forces to start an online music subscription service within several weeks to allow Netizens to buy and download digital music for their Macintosh or iPod." Do they expect to make profit out of this? How come here in the U.S., we hear of the many suicide bombings that Palestines perform against Israelis but we never hear or see the tragic and urlLink barbaric retaliation by the Israelis against Palestine? I mean, this seemed to pass over the radar screen without a blip. I'm not one to praise musicals(and I won't be seeing Moulin Rouge or Chicago anytime soon) but I just saw Singin' in the Rain for the first time a few days ago and I have to say, WOW. Not one actor or actress today can measure up to Gene Kelly or Debbie Reynolds. The singing, choreography, tap dancing, and acting itself in this movie far outweighs the actors we proclaim superstars today. One a side note, Gene Kelly is a graduate of Penn State. We have a pool here at work that we created back in February, guessing when the first day of the war will be with Iraq. I put down March 11th, looks like I may be pretty darn close. Like I said in my email to Nancy, "I'm not gonna tell you and say that oil has no factor in this war but I like to believe that GWB is a good, Christian man looking out for the U.S.'s best interests.....which is protecting us! Saddam is a madman. Like GWB's arguement, it is just a matter of time that the weapons he sells to terrorist groups or even weapons that he has in his hands ends up exploding on U.S. soil." I'm on edge like the rest of America and the time during war is a very anxious time but this is the right thing to do. We must take action now before we get bitten. This is just something very cool that I found. It's a urlLink picture of Lake Superior with huge ice chunks floating around. As you know this has been one of the coldest winters in many years and it's not everyday that Lake Superior becomes frozen over! This is very large picture so download may take a few minutes. I'll probably link more of these pictures with time. This type of VERY HIGH resolution satellite images can be found around once a month so I'll keep checking to see when new images come on in. Check out their samples of Same Ol' Road and Sanzen at urlLink this link . Meanwhile, an attorney for Great White says the band's manager always made sure he got permission from clubs for the use of pyrotechnics" Alrighty, I am out

I've ignored it for too long! THE BLOGGER! I can't promise continuous, more frequent updates but I'll try. Sometimes, you just have absolutely nothing to say, and sometimes you do. Let me say first that the South is more liberal than you may think it is. I know more people who are conservative in their views up North than I do down here. I think it's because of my proximity to the ATL. As you veer away from the big city, the views become less liberal. Sometimes I just don't know how liberals come up with their retarded arguments. It completely baffles me. Their arguments are completely idealistic and not realistic. That's the best I can do to capitulate their side. Who in the limelight are Bush supporters? Well let me say that Dennis Miller is one intelligent man. His reasoning behind his beliefs are so well thought out and just make so much sense. Try to catch an interview with him whenever you get the chance. He's recently done a spin of talkshows as of late so he might take some time off right now. I hope he writes a book soon. Maybe he's already in the thick of it. Ron Silver is another actor who is an avid Bush supporter. I need to look more into what he has to say but I did catch an interview with on the FNC Beltway Boys. Again, his arguments and opinions are so clear and well thought out. Thank goodness that the intelligent "hollywood" community supports the Bush Administration and not like people such as Fred Durst. One word....."AGREEANCE".....WTF is that???? Yes, I know Eddie Vedder is an extreme liberal and yes I am a fan of Pearl Jam but again, Eddie has an idealistic view of the world. It's a flawed vision. He has to wake up and smell the coffee. Although, I should thank him and his political followers for voting for Nader. If it wasn't for him.......well, you know the rest. And sort of keeping on the political side of things and getting into religion, does anybody you know feel this is the beginning of the end? Many people I have talked to believe that world events are coming together and lining up with what was foretold in the book of Revelations. Talking about the EU(european union), the Euphrates River(runs through Iraq), something like a 100 million man army(China and their backing of North Korea). I think they may be looking too much into what is happening right now. I don't know, I refuse to believe that God put us down here to just let us live until we screw it all up. What's the purpose behind that? I'm sure we all had the same drawn conclusions during WWI, WWII, the Civil War, Vietnam, and most likely during the coldest years of the "Cold War"(especially during the early '60s.) I think it's just natural for humans to look for Judgement Day and they want to be prepared for it. But for me, yes, I hope I will be ready but I can't go around looking for signs of impending doom. None of us know and I like to believe the human race has many, many more years ahead of it. In fact, I'm just gonna go out and say it. This is not the beginning of the end. However, if John Travolta does another Battlefield Earth, then I may have to do some rethinking. Oh shit, he's in talks to do a sequel. D'oh! DREDG Remember this band's name. El Cielo Remember the name of their latest CD. It's one of the best cd's I have picked up ever. They are a mix of Radiohead, A Perfect Circle, and Duran Duran. Yes, I said Duran Duran. But don't let that scare you. Seriously, you won't be disappointed by this cd. If you are, then your musical tastes are crap. Their second track off of this album is the best and you can go urlLink here to listen to it. It's called, "Same Ol' Road". Try out the other songs as well, especially "Sanzen"(track 3)! This won't be the last you will hear me talking about this band. I'm gonna go out and purchase their first cd soon. They will be in Philly on March 22nd, and yes I will be home during this time but their concert falls on one of the busiest days I will have had in a while so I hope to catch them another time. Quick note about the band....they are all in their mid 20s and grew up in Los Gatos, CA(a place I acutally have been), but now reside in So. Cal. The movie Daredevil was crap. The only saving grace of the movie was the acting by Colin Farrell and seeing Jennifer Garner in the black outfit. But other than that, this movie should just remain one movie. No sequel please. Just let it go! On the plus side, I did see the trailer for X-men 2.....this movie will be awesome. Have I said enough? For now, maybe.....

Three Lakes Frozen It hasn't happened in a long time but the Great Lakes of urlLink Huron, Erie, and Superior have all frozen over due to the harsh, bitterly cold, ongoing winter. Wildcats Congratulations to the urlLink Villanova Wildcats women's basketball team for defeating the Connecticut Huskies who had a 70 game winning streak. It was the longest winning streak in women's college basketball history. Snow in Philly for Thursday? Possibly!! Check out the lower right hand panel urlLink at this link . Check out the Rain/Snow line that goes south of Philly. Everything to the north of that line is mainly snow and to the south is mainly rain. This winter won't die! All this being said though, I think that Philadelphia will just get a cold rain while NYC and points north and west will get more snow out of this system. Anyway, it's going up to 80 today with mostly sunny skies here in Atlanta! HA HA!

DC Comics and Warner Bros.....a match made in hell! OK OK.....Warner Bros. Studios is completely destroying the comic book adaptations of two of our favorite super heros. Actually, I should say they have already destroyed the Batman franchise(can you say Joel Shumacher?) and now they are looking to destroy the Superman franchise. This is a disgrace. I have been following this situation ever since Batman and Robin came out. I knew at that time, that the whole concept of Batman on film has to be completely overhauled. And since then, WB studios has f*cked around with screenplay after screenplay, script after script, director after director. Now we are at the point that the Batman franchise has been shelved for the time being and the WB is now focusing their energy on the Superman franchise. This mainly has to do with the popularity of Smallville and how fresh Superman is in people's minds right now. Anyway, now let me get to the point here. Basically, like I said, Superman is now the focus but the WB can't even get this right. A-list actor after A-list is turning down the lead role mainly due to the stereotype that hampers the actor after he partakes in the role. But I also believe that these actors(and their agents as well) realize what a disgrace the going-script for the movie is right now! The creators of Superman must be rolling in their graves if they knew what the latest adaptation is. Just go to this urlLink link here and see what I am talking about. And the "actors" that the WB is hunting for add even more travesty to this situation. Ok, so I may be overreacting but this is Superman and Batman we are talking about here. This is part of the American pop culture and should be dealt with cautiously and reverently. More serious news... I won't be long here because the message is short. Screw the UN, it's time to cut the crap and begin the regime change in Iraq. Time to go in on our own and take matters into our own hands. I'm at the point where I think we should have gone in on our own in the first place and disregard the pathetic and irrelevant United Nations. We are now hurting ourselves in this delay. The daytime temperatures are rapidly increasing as we head further into March and the sandstorm season in Iraq is alive and well also. When the war begins, I can imagine the many helicopters(and other aircraft) that may go down as sand interrupts the mechanics of the engines and blades. It's now or never. If we wait to late March, it will be a BIG mistake. Patrick T. and peanuts I only know one person that is allergic to peanuts so Patrick Tomachevsky, urlLink this article is for you . GAS GAS GAS Well, we all know that the price at the pump is out of control these days but we are lucky here in Atlanta. The going rate is one of the cheapest in the country at just $1.45 a gallon. I'm sure San Franciscans are envious of that price as they are paying almost a dollar more per gallon at urlLink $2.43 !! D'oh! Johnny Cash movie Alot of stuff happening for Johnny Cash these days. First he has a radio single and the accompanying video spinning on top 40 stations and rolling out on VH1 and MTV2 respectively for his song in which he covers Nine Inch Nail's "Hurt".....(not bad if I do say so myself, albeit a bit depressing). Now there is new biopic of that will star Joaquin Phoenix(of "Signs" and "Gladiator" fame) as the man himself and Reese Witherspoon as his wife June Carter. Could be good movie but it is far off right now considering that the actors were just recently signed on to the film.

St. Patrick's Day Yes, it's St. Patrick's Day....Happy St. Patrick's Day to all! My friend Patrick is actually down here in the ATL. We are leaving in 5 or 6 hours to Savannah, GA, from this moment now which is around or almost 11 pm Sunday night. We hope to beat the treacherous Atlanta rush hour traffic. It's absolutely horrendous. Next stop is the second biggest St. Patrick's Day celebration in the world! Around 300,000 people come to Savannah each year on March 17th. It'll be quite a fest of beverages tomorrow to say the least. Then from there, we are heading back to the ATL and taking a flight up to Philly. That's it for now...later

From an email I recently received Take three minutes and read this-UK Daily Mirror article. No matter what your views on President Bush's statements about an upcoming war, this piece, from an English journalist, is very interesting. Just a word of background for those of you who aren't familiar with the United Kingdom's "Daily Mirror" newspaper. This notoriously left-wing journal normally is not supportive of the Colonials across the Atlantic. by Tony Parsons for the "Daily Mirror"... September 11, 2002 One year ago, the world witnessed a unique kind of broadcasting - the mass murder of thousands, live on television. As a lesson in the pitiless cruelty of the human race, September 11 was up there with Pol Pot's Mountain of Skulls in Cambodia, or the skeletal bodies stacked like garbage in the Nazi concentration camps. An unspeakable act so cruel, so calculated and so utterly merciless that surely the world could agree on one thing-nobody deserves this fate. Surely there could be consensus: The victims were truly innocent, the perpetrators truly evil. But to the world's eternal shame, 9/11 is increasingly seen as America's comeuppance. Incredibly, anti-Americanism has increased over the last year. There has always been a simmering resentment to the USA in this country [England]; too loud, too rich, too full of themselves, and so much happier than Europeans--but it has become an epidemic. And that seems incredible to me. More than that, it turns my stomach. America is this country's greatest friend and our staunchest ally. We are bonded to the US by culture, language and blood. A little over half a century ago, around half a million Americans died for our freedoms, as well as their own. Have we forgotten so soon? And exactly a year ago, thousands of ordinary men, women and children--not just Americans, but from dozens of countries--were butchered by a small group of religious fanatics. Are we so quick to betray these victims? What touched the heart about those who died in the Twin Towers and on the planes, was that we recognized them. Young fathers and mothers, somebody's son and somebody's daughter, husbands, wives and children, some unborn. And these people brought it on themselves? Their nation is to blame for their meticulously planned slaughter? These days you don't have to be some dust-encrusted nut job in Kabul or Karachi or Finsbury Park to see America as the Great Satan. The anti-American alliance is made up of self-loathing liberals who blame the Americans for every ill in the Third World, and conservatives suffering from power-envy, bitter that the world's only superpower can do what it likes without having to ask permission. The truth is that America has behaved with enormous restraint since September 11. Remember...Remember...Remember...the gut-wrenching tapes of weeping men phoning their wives to say, "I love you," before they were burned alive. Remember those people leaping to their deaths from the top of burning skyscrapers. Remember the hundreds of firemen buried alive. Remember the smiling face of that beautiful little girl who was on one of the planes with her mum. Remember... remember... And realize that America has never retaliated for 9/11 in anything like the way it could have. So a few al-Al-Qaeda tourists got locked up without a trial in Camp X-ray? Pass the Kleenex. So some Afghan wedding receptions were shot up after they merrily fired their semiautomatics in a sky full of American planes? A shame but maybe next time they should stick to confetti. AMERICA could have turned a large chunk of the world into a parking lot. That it didn't is a sign of strength. American voices are already being raised against attacking Iraq--that's what a democracy is for. How many in the Islamic world will have a minute's silence for the slaughtered innocents of 9/11? How many Islamic leaders will have the guts to say that the mass murder of 9/11 was an abomination? When the news of 9/11 broke on the West Bank, those freedom-loving Palestinians were dancing in the street. America watched all of that--and America didn't push the button. We should thank the stars that America is the most powerful nation in the world. I still find it incredible that 9/11 did not provoke all-out war. Not a "war on terrorism." A real war. The fundamentalist dudes are talking about "opening the gates of hell" if America attacks Iraq. Well, America could have opened the gates of hell like you wouldn't believe. The US is the most militarily powerful nation that ever strode the face of the earth. The campaign in Afghanistan may have been less than perfect and the planned war on Iraq may be misconceived. But don't blame America for not bringing peace and light to these wretched countries. How many democracies are there in the Middle East, or in the Muslim world? You can count them on the fingers of one hand - assuming you haven't had any chopped off for minor shoplifting. I love America, yet America is hated. I guess that makes me Bush's poodle. But I would rather be a dog in New York City than a Prince in Riyadh. Above all, America is hated because it is what every country wants to be, rich, free, strong, open, optimistic. Not ground down by the past, or religion, or some caste system. America is the best friend this country ever had and we should start remembering that. Or do you really think the USA is the root of all evil? Tell it to the loved ones of the men and women who leaped to their death from the burning towers. Tell it to the nursing mothers whose husbands died on one of the hijacked planes, or were ripped apart in a collapsing skyscraper. And tell it to the hundreds of young widows whose husbands worked for the New York Fire Department. To our shame, George Bush gets a worse press than Saddam Hussein. Once we were told that Saddam gassed the Kurds, tortured his own people and set up rape-camps in Kuwait. Remember... remember... September 11th. One of the greatest atrocities in human history was committed against America. No, do more than remember: Never forget.

Can you believe it? Philadelphia sports' teams are coming up huge during the final stretch of their respective seasons and the another team is getting off on the right foot. If they stay under the Devils, they will have to contend with the solid Maple Leafs but if they finish first, they'll play the less-skilled Boston Bruins. I'll take the Bruins over the Maple Leafs any day of the week. The Sixers are just a urlLink half a point separated from the faltering-of-late but still #1 in the Atlantic Division, New Jersey Nets. Also, now they are just two points away from the top team of the East, the Detroit Pistons. The Sixers have an almost equal chance of playing either the Bucks, the Magic, or the Celtics. I'm not sure who I'd want to play but I probably would go with the Bucks. Now the Phillies ...oh the Phillies. Way too early to speculate but when the Phillies are 2 and 0 and the Braves are 0 and 2 and in last place, that's always good in my book! Mr. Wiesak Goes to New York Hey guys. As you know, Tom Wiesak loves the music industry and has always sought after a career in the music/recording industry. I'm not sure if you know, Tom, for all intents and purposes, has lost interest in his current job and has done some soul searching. So he wanted me to make an all around announcement for him instead of the impersonal mass email. After some thinking, and we all know that his thinking takes a LONG time, he has decided to pursue this dream of his. He has searched and searched available jobs at record companies that he admires, i.e. Def Jam and Murder Inc. (Seriously, he believes Russell Simmons is one of the greatest businessmen in the music industry). However, these jobs were few and far between so he decided to go a different direction and found this available urlLink job at New Line Cinema. As you probably know, Tom's current job requires skills revolving around navigating around MS Office and more specifically, working with databases on an EXCEL platform. Anyway, you'll see that this job that Tom has found at NLC requires much of these same skills. This obviously isn't exactly what Tom is looking for but it is a very big step toward his ultimate goal which is basically setting up the logistics that are necessary to either A. Promotion of an up and coming band/artist or B. Promotion of a CD from an already established band. Suffice it to say, Tom didn't have all the skills mentioned in the Job Posting but from what Tom told me, they actually liked his enthusiasm of the music/theatre industry and more importantly were impressed from his database skills and knowledge of SQR. Cutting to the chase, Tom GOT THE JOB!!! Congrats to Tommy W. He's actually leaving for the big city of NYC(specifically Manhattan) in late April so I'll be home and will be having a goodbye party for him at my parent's place(they'll be in Ireland). Wish him congrats at twiesak@hotmail.com.

Bob Crane-Colonel Hogan So I just saw the movie, urlLink Auto Focus , now out on video. It's about the professional life of Bob Crane, Hogan from the 1960 TV series, Hogan's Heroes. I highly recommend this movie. Greg Kinnear pulls off a great Bob Crane and Willem Dafoe plays Crane's best friend. Kinnear plays a man early on in the movie torn between a moral life or a life filled with sex and infidelity. You then see him sink more and more to a very unstable life. Dafoe, although a person who plays Crane's best friend John Carpenter, seems to really portray Crane's conscious. Go out and rent this movie....it's definitely a movie that a guy and a girl can enjoy! Steve Beauparlant, I want you to rent this movie and give a review by next Monday! Phone Booth Yep, just saw this movie at the theatre. I'm not trying to step on Steve's movie review page but since I just saw three movies in a matter of 15 hours, I had to put something down on paper. I have to give this movie a B verging on B- status. I'm not sure, maybe it's because I like more locations in a movie but I got bored during this movie. The movie pretty much revolves around this one phone booth and we don't go anywhere else. It bores the senses a bit. Again, just like in Daredevil, Colin Farrel carries the movie on his shoulder. I'd wait to see this movie on video. Out of left field Here's an urlLink mp3 of U2's performance of "The Hands that Built America" from the Oscars.... From urlLink Batman-on-Film ... To give you a head's up, Chris Nolan is the person who directed the incredible, Memento (if you haven't seen Memento, go see it now!) Nolan to do THE FRIGHTENING, rewritten by Goyer! Wednesday, April 2, 2003: I can't say who this source is, but trust me, this is legit, OK? According to this source, Chris Nolan has decided to go with the BATMAN: THE FRIGHTENING and it will be rewritten by David Goyer. This individual tells BOF that with rewrites, sometimes it is totally changed, while other times it stays pretty close to the original script. Now, the script that I read--and that got loose all over the net--was pretty darn good. Good concept, but it was clearly a sequel to the previous four Bat-films. And it has been indicated to me that Nolan plans to restart the series and go with a new continuity. So I guess you can safely assume that The Scarecrow will be the villian in the next Bat-film. I am still looking into this, so keep checking here at BATMAN ON FILM for the latest Bat-movie news!

It's been a while.... Ok, I did a pretty big update at the urlLink OLD CONVOLUTION ! Actually, when it comes right down to it, it probably won't seem like a big update. Busy workweek I'm sure nobody cares, but I had one of the busiest workweeks at the Weather Channel. There were more than 300 reports of tornadoes from May 4th to the 10th last week. Severe weather was continually on-going and spread over a good portion of the U.S. The brightspot came on Sunday morning when I was interviewed by ABCNEWS...that was pretty cool. Pearl Jam Guitarist Goes Public with Crohn's It's a pretty serious, painful, and embarrasing disease.....and not to make light of the situation, but there are a few really funny quotes from Mike himself about the times that Crohn's kicked in during concerts. NEW YORK (Billboard) - Some rock stars run offstage into the arms of a beautiful woman, but Pearl Jam lead guitarist Mike McCready often finds himself running ... right to the bathroom. McCready, 37, has suffered for more than 15 years from the debilitating stomach disorder Crohn's disease. He went public with his story May 13, when he spoke at the Northwest Chapter of the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America's (CCFA) third annual Many Faces of Hope luncheon in Seattle. McCready only summoned the courage to speak publicly about his disease after meeting last fall with other Crohn's sufferers. "The stories they told me were far worse than what I've experienced," he says. "One kid was 14 and had had six surgeries and still wasn't cured. I wanted to put myself out there and say, 'I've had a career in spite of Crohn's disease.' I learned from these kids, and that gives me a lot of strength and hope." Researchers are not sure what causes Crohn's, and there is no cure. Patients are subjected to an extensive regimen of medication and must constantly monitor their diet. McCready takes three different drugs and has been in remission for about eight months. "It is such a strange disease," he says. "You can do everything possible that you think is right, and it can still come back." During his speech, the artist related a particularly embarrassing incident to demonstrate how Crohn's can strike at any time. "Playing onstage, I'm always aware of where the bathrooms are," he admits. "When Crohn's hits, I have to run, or it won't be pretty. It happened when we opened up for the Rolling Stones in 1997 in Oakland . "It was our first show with them," McCready continues. "Five minutes before we went on, I went up to (Pearl Jam frontman) Eddie (Vedder) and I said, 'Look man, can we play 'Sometimes'? -- which is a slower song that I'm not really on. I was in pain. I went running offstage looking for a bathroom, and there wasn't one. Then, all of a sudden, there was one. It was a honeybucket. I heard my band play that song from inside a portable toilet!" McCready says he is lucky to have the support of his bandmates, all of whom were on hand for his speech. (The group resumes its summer North American tour May 28 in Missoula, Mont.) Indeed, some proceeds from Pearl Jam's Seattle shows last December were donated to the CCFA, and McCready plans to remain active with the Northwest chapter of the organization. Two days after his address, McCready played a CCFA charity concert with his side band, the Rockfords. "Crohn's can be humiliating and restricting," McCready says. "But getting in touch with an organization like CCFA has allowed me to begin dealing with those negatives in a positive way."

The Hulk Damn, this movie was quite.....well......boring. Don't get me wrong, the acting in this movie(esp. from Nick Nolte) is really good. I also really wanted to like this movie but I found myself struggling to keep my eyes open. Ang Lee, the director, creates a movie that probably is too "high brow" and too smart for comic book fans. The dialogue between characters went on and on and was drawn out. You almost wanted to say, "get to the action already!" Even with the overextended dialogue, I found myself still trying to figure out the progress of the film. For instance, you expect the Hulk's first tranformation from Bruce Banner to the Hulk to be of significant cause and effect factors. Something completely over the top forces Banner to go over the edge! But that doesn't happen. Before you know it, the first transformation of Banner into the Hulk occurs and you are left wondering, what set him off? What put him over the edge? Anyway, it's a video movie IMO. Wait for July 2nd and the Rise of the Machines! Woo hoo! Can't wait.

Latest Bat news If any of you are interested, Ashton Kutcher has been in the rumorville as he's been said as being the best prospect for the new Batman movie. Now I think Ashton is a good actor but in no way should he be involved in the Batman movies!! First of all remember that Chris Nolan has already been hired by WB to direct this movie. He's the man who directed the movie Memento .....a very underrated movie. So Nolan has some power in who he wants to cast and direct. After visiting urlLink www.batman-on-film.com , I read this supposed latest news on the progress of the new movie. Good news if you don't want Ashton to be the next Batman!! Kutcher will NOT be Cast as Bruce Wayne. Nolan want's an unknown, He thinks Kutcher comes with too much baggage (Dude Where's My Car?, That 70's Show). He thinks Kutchers antics as of late to try and gain publicity nods and attention (dating Demi) is uncalled for and pathetic. Apparently Nolan told Kutchers camp that he would consider him for the part if he started acting like Mature Hollywood and less like the idiot he plays on That 70's Show. He doesn't think that Kutcher would suit the needs of the BATMAN audience, the way that Clooney/Kilmer did, and even though Nolan wants "Young Hollywood" in the next Batman flick, he said that Kutcher just doesn't fit the part, nor will he ever. When Nolan told Ashton's camp he needed to be more mature, he didn't mean to grab an older more respected Actress in Hollywood and try to "Date" her. The Demi Moore/Ashton Kutcher "Romance" is a publicity stunt, One which will not score Kutcher the part in the new Batman Flick. Other Batman News: Al Gough will be the only Original cast member to Return (Gough of course plays the part of Alfred Pennyworth). Christopher Lloyd has been chosen to play the part of the evil villain Dr. Jonathan Crane (AKA "The Scarecrow"). These are the only two cast members attached to the project thus far, and I can guarantee that Ashon Kutchers name will not be included in the credits when the film finally does hit theaters. Second day of STP news From Blabbermouth.net: STONE TEMPLE PILOTS: Greatest Hits Collection, DVD To Surface In November - Aug. 19, 2003 STONE TEMPLE PILOTS will be releasing a "greatest hits" album, tentatively titled "Thank You", on November 4 through Atlantic Records. The album will feature 14 of the bands hit songs, plus an acoustic version of "Plush" and a new track called "All In The Suit That You Wear". The greatest hits set will draw from STP's five albums: "Core" (1992), "Purple" (1994), "Tiny Music - Songs From the Vatican Gift Shop" (1996), "No. 4" (1999) and "Shangri-La De Da" (2001). In addition, the group will issue a DVD containing all of the band's music videos and about an hour of other live performances and photos, as well as some "home" footage the band has shot over the years. The CD will be available separately or as a CD/DVD package, according to the band's web site. In 2000, the group had planned to release a hits compilation called "Big Bang Babies" but scrapped the record after a management shakeup.

Savannah Trip (Aug 22, 23) Left with Chris and Rory for Savannah on Fri afternoon at 1pm. Got down to Savannah at around 4:30 and checked into the hotel. Drank about 3 or 4 beers then traveled the streets of Savannah. For some reason, Chris knew way too much about Savannah and was pointing out all the landmarks around town. He read the book, Midnight in the Garden of Eden or something like that which takes place in Savannah. We also saw the town square and park bench where Forest Gump was shot at. Not physically shot with a gun but the filming of the movie. Although, Gump was shot in the movie....right in the but-tox sir. Came back to the hotel, had a few more drinks then met up with my friend Jeff and his girlfrind who live in Savannah. We headed out to dinner around 7:30 to a seafood place. Mmm, mmm good buffalo shrimp. I now know buffalo shrimp is not large shrimp but actually spicy shrimp. I thought because buffalo rhymed with jumbo that they were one in the same. I was sadly mistaken. This, by the way, all takes place along the river on Riverside street (portions of the street are covered in original cobblestones). Restaurants, pubs, and shops are all along the Savannah river. Anyway, while eating dinner, we noticed the street performers across the street. One dude was on a unicycle who juggled, did tricks, and played with the audience. Then another group of performers were breakdancers. They were amazing. I took pictures of all of this so I'll get them posted eventually. Anyway, drinking then continued until 3am and we were up Sat. morning at around 11am 'cause that was checkout time. I was hurtin' but got some pizza and water in me and i was doing good after that. We headed to Tybee Island which was amazing. Water was around 72-75 degrees. I've never been in ocean water that warm before. Was out there for 2 and a half hours and put on 30 sunblock. (by the way, I have realized that 15 and 30 sunblock do just the same as 45 or 75 or 95 block). I missed however some portions of my right side and have a big red welt on my side now. Doesn't hurt though. So that's about it. We pretty much took off for home right after Tybee Island. Played soccer on Sunday night and we actually have a good team. We won 6-1. Looking forward to the season.

Weiland Divorces From Eonline.com: DIVORCING: Stone Temple Pilots frontman Scott Weiland filed for divorce Tuesday from his wife Mary, less than two months after a failed attempt at reconciliation. The couple married on May 22, 2000 and separated on September 19, 2002. Mary Weiland filed for divorce two days later, but subsequently dropped the case. More STP news: From STP.com A special edition of Stone Temple Pilots' upcoming Atlantic best-of set, "Thank You," will include a DVD packed with three hours of videos, live performances and footage of the band shot by friends and fans. Due Nov. 11, the 15-track audio anthology will be available with and without the DVD. The DVD will feature clips for 32 songs, including such hits as "Interstate Love Song," "Sex Type Thing" and "Vasoline." Highlights include a rendition of the Aerosmith classic "Sweet Emotion" with the band's Steven Tyler and Joe Perry and run through Glen Campbell's "Wichita Lineman" with the artist. As previously reported, the tracks on the "Thank You" audio disc survey the band's five studio albums, which have sold a combined 12 million copies in the U.S., according to Nielsen SoundScan. The set boasts the new song "All in the Suit You Wear," which can be sampled on the band's official Web site. As a group, STP has been more or less dormant in the last year. Singer Scott Weiland, who has publicly battled addiction through a series of arrests and stints in rehab, has most recently been involved with the band Velvet Revolver. Rounded out by former Guns N' Roses members Slash, Duff McKagan and Matt Sorum plus Suicidal Tendencies' David Kushner, the band is eyeing a February release for its debut RCA album. STP bassist Robert DeLeo and his guitarist brother Dean produced Alien Ant Farm's latest album, "truANT." Released in August, the set debuted at No. 42 on The Billboard 200. Here is the "Thank You" audio CD track list: "Vasoline" "Down" "Wicked Garden" "Big Empty" "Plush" "Big Bang Baby" "Creep" "Lady Picture Show" "Trippin' on a Hole in a Paper Heart" "Interstate Love Song" "In the Suit That You Wear" "Sex Type Thing" "Days of the Week" "Sour Girl" "Plush" (acoustic) Here is the "Thank You" DVD track list: "Dead & Bloated" "Army Ants" "Interstate Love Song" "Silvergun Superman" "Crackerman" "Plush" "Trippin' on a Hole in a Paper Heart" "Hollywood Bitch" "Big Empty" "Long Way Home" "Down" "Meat Plow" "Tumble in the Rough" "Sex & Violence" "Wicked Garden" "Atlanta" "Where the River Goes" "Pop's Love Suicide" "Sweet Emotion" "Big Bang Baby" "Pretty Penny" "Lounge Fly" "Wonderful" "Creep" "Too Cool Queenie" "Wichita Lineman" "Sex Type Thing" "Vasoline" "Lady Picture Show" "Sour Girl" "Days of the Week" "Hello, It's Late"

Weiland Can't Keep it Together Rocker Weiland Arrested After Hollywood Car Crash Wed Oct 29, 6:14 PM ET Add Entertainment - Reuters to My Yahoo! LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Days after a judge warned him to stay off drugs, ill-starred rocker Scott Weiland (news) marked his 36th birthday by crashing into a parked car in Hollywood and leaving the scene, Los Angeles police said on Wednesday. The former singer with chart-topping rock band Stone Temple Pilots was quickly arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence following the incident, which happened early Monday morning. He was released later that day after posting $15,000 bail. Los Angeles Police Dept. spokesman Officer Jason Lee (news) said the charge carries an additional request for hit-and-run on account of Weiland's alleged failure to stop after hitting the car with his BMW. Damage to both cars was moderate, Lee said. He is scheduled to be arraigned in Los Angeles Municipal Court on Nov. 17. A spokesman for the Los Angeles City Attorney said a charge of one count of driving under the influence would probably be filed later today. The details of the incident were first reported by music news Web site blabbermouth.net. A spokeswoman for Weiland's current band, Velvet Revolver, declined to comment. Weiland has a long history of inter-related drug and legal problems. Most recently, he entered a no-contest plea to two felony drug possession charges in August, and was ordered to enter a drug counseling program. He has completed most of the requirements, and on Oct. 20 a Pasadena judge allowed him to remain free as long as he stayed clean. In 1999, he served five months of an 11-month jail sentence in connection with an arrest for heroin possession the year before. Weiland's problems contributed to the demise of Stone Temple Pilots. His new band, Velvet Revolver, which includes former members of Guns N' Roses, is recording its debut album. TV Specials Coming in November for Sweeps Note from me... The Andy Griffith (news) Show Reunion: Back to Mayberry (November 11, CBS): Andy Griffith, Ron Howard (news), Don Knotts (news) and Jim Nabors (news) reminisce about Aunt Bea's pies. Britney Spears (news): In the Zone (November 17, ABC): In anticipation of her new album, due out November 18, Miss Spears takes Manhattan in a concert taped at Gotham Hall and featuring our heroine in a "variety of incarnations that are sexy, Gothic, romantic and truly eye-popping." You were expecting "scholarly"? The Victoria's Secret Fashion Show (November 19, CBS): Tyra Banks (news), Gisele Bundchen and Heidi Klum celebrate Broadway. Oh, yeah, and show off underwear. Sting and Mary J. Blige (news) are on hand for the festivities. Queer Eye for the Straight Guy (November 25, NBC): The Fab Five return to prime time to save us from further episodes of Whoopi and Happy Family. Justin Timberlake (news): Down Home in Memphis (November 25, NBC): Britney's ex returns to his Tennessee hometown for a concert--but does he introduce Cameron Diaz (news) to the folks? American Idol: Christmas Songs (November 25, Fox): Ruben and Clay croon chestnut classics. Nearly forgotten first-season Idols Kelly Clarkson (news) and Justin Guarini also appear, along with also-rans Christina Christian, Tamyra Gray and Kimberly Locke. If you miss the TV show, Fox suggests you buy the album, in stores since mid-October. Trista and Ryan's Wedding (November 26, ABC): Bachelorette lovebirds Trista Rehn and Ryan Sutter confirm their precious love before the TV nation in three prime-time specials. This sweeps edition, the first of the bunch, finds the fun couple making important decisions about designer wedding cake and such. Look for the ring exchange to go down in a two-hour event on December 10. Untitled Shania Twain (news) Special (November 26, NBC): Like Timberlake, the country-pop diva takes her act to Tennessee--specifically Nashville. NBC promises the show "will appeal to all ages." No word if fun will be had by all, or just some. TV MOVIES Phenomenon II (Saturday, ABC): A new, made-for-TV sequel to the 1996 John Travolta (news) film, minus John Travolta. Christopher Shyer takes over for the star as the touched-by-an-E.T. George Malley. Saving Jessica Lynch (November 9, NBC): Newcomer Laura Regan plays the world's most famous 19-year-old Army private in this docudrama that's actually based on the story of the Iraqi who led U.S. forces to Lynch's location. The Elizabeth Smart Story (November 9, CBS): A docudrama about the teen who was kidnapped from, and eventually returned to, her Utah home. After Lynch, this is the season's second-most exploited true-life tale. The Challenge (November 15, ABC): Call this the anti-docudrama. Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen star as on-the-outs twins who reunite to play a reality game in order to win college scholarships. The Reagans (November 16 and November 18, CBS): The four-hour miniseries promises to deliver the goods on the "enduring and passionate love affair" of B-movie actors turned A-list world figures Ronald and Nancy Reagan. James Brolin crinkles up his eyes as the nation's 40th President. Judy Davis (news) chews up any and all scenery left over from her Judy Garland (news) biopic.

Why Hockey Players are the toughest athletes.... From last night's game vs. Columbus: COLUMBUS, Ohio - A minute and 32 seconds remained in the second period when Donald Brashear missed a check, and his stick caught Flyers teammate Sami Kapanen flush in the mouth and bloodied him. Kapanen went down, losing two teeth and shattering two others. "Not a lot of pain, but I felt like I had a mouthful of sand," the winger said. Some players would have called it a night. Kapanen didn't. He came back in the third period to score his first goal in 11 games, pulling out a 1-1 tie for the Flyers against the Columbus Blue Jackets tonight at Nationwide Arena.

Katie Holmes in next Bat-flic k Inside Move: Holmes may join 'Batman' Helmer likely to cast 'April' star after read-through By MICHAEL FLEMING, CATHY DUNKLEY Warner Bros. is zeroing in on Katie Holmes for the female lead of its next "Batman" film. Holmes has been offered the role, subject to a screen test with Christian Bale that will be conducted by director Christopher Nolan. While Nolan considered many young actresses to play Batman's love interest Rachel, Holmes is the only actress who will do a screen test. It is considered likely that a deal will follow shortly after. Holmes would be the third thesp cast. Nolan, who came aboard the film with his producing partner Emma Thomas, first set Christian Bale as the Caped Crusader, and recently began negotiating with Michael Caine to play his butler, Alfred. They've been mum about the storyline that was scripted by David Goyer, but WB and Nolan are gearing up for a 2004 start date and 2005 release of what had been the studio's most viable franchise until "The Matrix." WB exec Greg Silverman is the presiding Bat-exec. While she is best known for "Dawson's Creek," the CAA-repped Holmes has quietly established herself on screen by working with such directors as Ang Lee, Curtis Hanson and Sam Raimi. She just opened in "The Singing Detective" and "Pieces of April," and she has been working on the Forest Whitaker-directed "First Daughter." Dan Reeves Fired!! A statement from The WB: For the last seven years Angel and Buffy the Vampire Slayer have been cornerstones of our network. The sum total of the work done on those shows has produced some of the proudest moments in our history. Like some of the great series that are leaving the air this year, including Frasier and Friends, the cast, crew, writers and producers of Angel deserve to be able to wrap up the series in a way befitting a classic television series and that is why we went to Joss to let him know that this would be the last year of the series on The WB. We have discussed continuing the Angel legacy with special movie events next year, which is still on the table. In a perfect world, all of these details would be completed before this information went to the press so that we could be definitive about the show's ongoing future. But in any case, we did not want to contemplate this being the last year of Angel without giving the show the option of crafting their own destiny for this character and for this series. David Boreanaz continues to be one of the finest, classiest and friendliest actors we have had the pleasure to work with and we hope that the relationship furthers from here. The same can be said for all the actors and producers on the show. Stealing this website from a guy who does "web pick of the day" selections... And spineless. Below that: It was detonated before it could be defused, producing "a very small dispersal" of the gas, he said. Very small. Nothing to see here. Let's discuss Abu Ghraib for a change. So the crowd that gets hysterical when a kid brings a toy gun to school, is pretty tolerant when just a "small" amount of WMDs are found. If a Costco warehouse filled with this stuff was found, THEN, it would matter, right? But, it doesn't matter. The rules of playing Spin the Tale with the Donkey change everyday with each claim debunked. They hate America, they hate Bush, and the American people will see the contrast...or not...in November. THEY'RE LEGAL! Olsen twins turn 18, giving dirty old men more fantasy fodder By Dan Gross grossd@phillynews.com DROOL AWAY. If you have the hots for the Olsen twins, you're no longer a total perv. You're at least much less of one. Because Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen turned 18 yesterday. No doubt they celebrated, as did legions of men who have literally been counting the hours, minutes and seconds till their crossover to adulthood. The former "Full House" TV stars have earned a loyal following of young girls for nearly a decade with videos like "Passport to Paris" and "You're Invited to Mary-Kate and Ashley's Ballet Party." But in recent years, Mary-Kate and Ashley have found new admirers among men old enough to be their fathers. For a few years now, oodles of Web sites have counted down the seconds until the twins could legally be lusted after. "Oh, boys will be boys," Mary-Kate has said of the phenomenon. "We are not sexy," she told CBS' "48 Hours" last year. "Don't know how to explain it." Dr. Joyce Brothers knows how to explain it. "They have a clean image. Men want to defile the clean image," the psychologist said in a recent phone interview. Men also want women to think they're good lovers, and according to Brothers, "the younger the girl is, the less she is going to have for comparison." Y100 morning host Preston Elliot is a little more blunt. "The whole twin thing is a lifelong goal for all perverted guys," said Elliot, 36. "Shamefully but proudly do I include myself in that." And it doesn't hurt, he said, that "they're sexy, attractive girls. They're famous. They're billionaires." Well, not quite billionaires, but they are rich. The Olsens, who will attend New York University in the fall, each have a fortune estimated by CNN at more than $150 million. Elliot and co-host Steve Morrison, 45, considered holding a "Dirty Old Man" screening of "New York Minute," the Olsens' recently released, first feature film. But it turns out even dirty old men have standards. "It just looked like a crappy movie," said Elliot of the movie, which flopped. The guys did hold a screening for "Mean Girls," which stars 17-year-old Lindsay Lohan. For those counting, Lohan crosses the jailbait line on July 2. Q102 morning co-host Angi Taylor isn't turned on by the Olsens, but she admires them as "very intelligent businesswomen." They certainly are. When "Full House" ended in 1995, the then 9-year-olds - who had taken turns playing Michelle Tanner since they were 9 months old - created their own production company, Dualstar, along with their manager, Robert Thorne. Since then, they've created an empire of straight-to-video releases, clothing, CDs, dolls, makeup, fragrances and even a magazine, all aimed at a core audience of pre-teen girls. Speaking of "Full House," the twins' TV father, Mount Airy native Bob Saget, declined to be interviewed for this story. Chase Brown, 22, of Michigan, started his online countdown "two or three years ago" after he saw people chatting online about the Olsens' birthday. He said he thought it would be funny. Brown's site, chasebrown.com/olson.htm, not only misspells the girls' last name but includes a link to send Brown a donation to keep the site alive - something he says several hundred visitors from around the world have done. Brown also operates about 30 adult Web sites. While he finds the twins too thin to be attractive, "I think most people would want to see them in Playboy. "I know in the industry there's buzz about them." Veteran porn director/actor Bill Margold disagrees. "The only way they would do well is if they did each other," he said. Brown recently launched hilaryduffcountdown.com to tick off the seconds until that actress's 18th birthday, Sept. 28, 2005. Isn't it a little strange to pay so much attention to 14-, 15- or 16-year-old girls? "I guess it's kind of weird," Brown admitted. "But it wasn't like, 'Oh yeah I can't wait till they're legal so I can morally masturbate to them.' I just thought it would be funny. It's all a big joke really." If it is a joke, even the Olsens are in on it. At the end of a recent "Saturday Night Live" they hosted, one twin reminded the audience, "We're legal in four weeks." Said Brothers, "They're laughing it off, and laughing all the way to the bank." Entertainment industry vets that they are, they probably know any publicity is good publicity. Added Brothers, "They've grown up with it, they're totally comfortable with it and they're using it in positive ways." Michelle Malkin doesn't think the Olsen obsession is positive, or funny. "It's a sign of the acceptance of pedophilia chic that these men could run these sites and nobody condemns it," says the conservative and often controversial syndicated columnist, who appears in the Daily News. "Someday when they have daughters, I hope they look back on what they do with these Web sites and feel ashamed of themselves." The advertising industry has been sexualizing women at younger and younger ages since the 1980s, Malkin contended, though she also thinks the Olsens have maintained a wholesome image. Taylor summed up Olsen lust as nothing more than harmless fantasy. "What do these guys think is gonna happen, the Olsens are gonna [turn 18 and] go trolling the streets of Philly looking for some guy?" Still, she said, "It is a little twisted. "You never hear a 16-year-old kid being like, 'Dude, they're gonna be 18!' It's always some 45-year-old fatass that's waiting for it." Not anymore they're not.
Update on Mr. Jennings He's now broken the HALF MILL point! urlLink 16 consecutive victories ...nuts!

14 days and still questioning... At one point, if you were a contestant on Jeopardy! and did very well day after day, you were limited to only about 5 appearances I beleive. But now, they got rid of that restriction and it may have been just a tad too soon. You see, there is this man named urlLink Ken Jennings from Utah who just keeps on winning. On Monday, June 21st, he won yet again which marks his 14th day in a row that he has questioned his way to a victory. Simply amazing. His totals have added up to $471,759 . Remember to watch on your favorite local Jeopardy! channel to see if Ken can keep it going.
